Package userinterface

Class AddressBar

java.lang.Object
userinterface.AbstractFrame
userinterface.DocumentCell
userinterface.UITextInputField
userinterface.AddressBar
All Implemented Interfaces:
DocumentListener
public class AddressBar
extends UITextInputField
implements DocumentListener
A class to represent an address bar in the browsr, as an extension of a AbstractFrame, in the UI layer.

  • Constructor Details

    • AddressBar

      public AddressBar​(int x, int y, int width, int height, int offset) throws IllegalDimensionException
      Creates an AddressBar object.
      Parameters:
      x - : x-position on the window
      y - : y-position on the window
      width - : the width of this AddressBar
      height - : the height of this AddressBar
      offset - : distance between this AddressBar and left, right and top window edge
      Throws:
      IllegalDimensionException

  • Method Details

    • contentChanged

      public void contentChanged()
      Method that specifies what this AddressBar should do when it gets notified of a content-change
      Specified by:
      contentChanged in interface DocumentListener

    • handleResize

      public void handleResize​(int newWindowWidth, int newWindowHeight)
      This method handles resizes. It makes sure the addressBar is adjusted in width when the window shrinks or grows. It does not change its height (e.g. look at Firefox).

      N.B.: without this method, BookmakrBar would be rendered with the given absolute width, and thus one would need to guess the correct initial size of the window. Using this mehtod, widths are automatically adjusted: both at initialisation and at runtime.

      Overrides:
      handleResize in class DocumentCell
      Parameters:
      newWindowHeight - : parameter containing the new window-height
      newWindowWidth - : parameter containing the new window-width

    • getURL

      public java.lang.String getURL()
      Get the current url of the AddressBar.
      Returns:
      the url string of this AddressBar.

    • changeURLto

      public void changeURLto​(java.lang.String URL)
      Externally change the url, this moves the cursor to the right and toggles focus off.
      Parameters:
      URL - The String representation of the url to be set

    • setUiController
